page.title: 01BISLEY AREA
page.content: The area is one of outstanding natural beauty and mainly farmland. This is nearly all arable and the woods are beech. The centre of the area is dominated by the upper end of the Toadsmoor Valley. It contains two villages,Bisley and Eastcombe, and several hamlets:Bournes Green, Nashend Stancombe, Battlescombe, Througham, Lypiatt and Scrubbs. The area is served by the Bisley with Lypiatt Parish Council, the Stroud District Council, in the county of Gloucester- shire. The majority of the inhabitants work and do their major shopping outside the area in the nearby towns and cities of Stroud, Gloucester and Cheltenham. There is a very limited bus service and most households have at least one car. The highest land point is over 800 feet above sealevel. The rockbed is limestone.
